location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.8 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The item is a covering letter, enclosing a further letter (no.192 of 1852) from Commodore George Robinson, Commanding the Persian Gulf Naval Squadron, to Kemball, dated 19 December 1852. Robinson's letter is a report of his recent tour to the Arab coast on the Honourable Company's sloop Clive. Robinson informs Kemball of a minor disturbance between the inhabitants of Sharja [Shargah] and Debai, arising from the 'seizure of planks' by the former from the latter.
